intro: Isertia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved isertia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in umbels, and bloom in the spring. It prefers shaded, moist environments and is often found in humid tropical forests.
